toxi.physics3d

Class ParticleString3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • toxi.physics3d.ParticleString3D

  • public class ParticleString3D
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility builder/grouping/management class to connect a set of particles into a physical string/thread. Custom spring types can be used by subclassing this class and overwriting the createSpring(VerletParticle3D, VerletParticle3D, float, float) method.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.List<VerletSpring3D> links 
      java.util.List<VerletParticle3D> particles 
      protected VerletPhysics3D physics 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ParticleString3D(VerletPhysics3D physics, java.util.List<VerletParticle3D> plist, float strength)
      Takes a list of already created particles connects them into a continuous string using springs.
      ParticleString3D(VerletPhysics3D physics, Vec3D pos, Vec3D step, int num, float mass, float strength)
      Creates a number of particles along a line and connects them into a string using springs.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParticleString3D

        public ParticleString3D(VerletPhysics3D physics,
                        java.util.List<VerletParticle3D> plist,
                        float strength)
        Takes a list of already created particles connects them into a continuous string using springs.
        Parameters:
        physics - physics engine instance
        plist - particle list
        strength - spring strength

      • ParticleString3D

        public ParticleString3D(VerletPhysics3D physics,
                        Vec3D pos,
                        Vec3D step,
                        int num,
                        float mass,
                        float strength)
        Creates a number of particles along a line and connects them into a string using springs.
        Parameters:
        physics - physics engine
        pos - start position
        step - step direction & distance between successive particles
        num - number of particles
        mass - particle mass
        strength - spring strength

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes the entire string from the physics simulation, incl. all of its particles & springs.

      • createSpring

        protected VerletSpring3D createSpring(VerletParticle3D a,
                                      VerletParticle3D b,
                                      float len,
                                      float strength)
        Creates a spring instance connecting 2 successive particles of the string. Overwrite this method to create a string custom spring types (subclassed from VerletSpring3D).
        Parameters:
        a - 1st particle
        b - 2nd particle
        len - rest length
        strength -
        Returns:
        spring

        public VerletParticle3D getHead()
        Returns the first particle of the string.

        public int getNumParticles()

        Returns:

      • getTail

        public VerletParticle3D getTail()

        Returns:
